actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to provide that certain aliens illegally in the United States may have their status adjusted to that of permanent residents.

summary.text: Specifies conditions under which the Attorney General shall adjust the status of aliens who are illegally in the U.S. to that of permanent residents provided the alien is the spouse, parent, son or daughter of a U.S. citizen or an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence and is entitled to a preference status under the Immigration and Nationality Act; or entered the United States before June 30, 1948, and has been continuously present within the United States from the date of his entry until the date of enactment of this Act.

titles.title: A bill to provide that certain aliens illegally in the United States may have their status adjusted to that of permanent residents.
